content: <metadata>   <idinfo>     <citation>       <citeinfo>         <origin>City and County of Denver, Department of Environmental Health</origin>         <pubdate>20110615</pubdate>         <title>Instream Sampling Sites</title>         <geoform>vector digital data</geoform>       </citeinfo>     </citation>     <descript>       <abstract>Points on Cherry Creek, the South Platte River, and other tributaries where water samples are taken by Denver Environmental Health (DEH) personnel for the purpose of water quality monitoring and analysis.</abstract>       <purpose>Shows the locations of Cherry Creek, South Platte River and other Denver Environmental Health (DEH) instream water quality monitoring sites.  Allows data collected at these sites to be mapped spatially and temporally.</purpose>     </descript>     <status>       <update>As needed</update>     </status>     <spdom>       <bounding>         <westbc>-105.100042</westbc>         <eastbc>-104.856556</eastbc>         <northbc>39.798159</northbc>         <southbc>39.566909</southbc>       </bounding>     </spdom>     <keywords>       <theme>         <themekt>None</themekt>         <themekey>water quality</themekey>       </theme>       <theme>         <themekt>ISO 19115 Topic Categories</themekt>         <themekey>biota</themekey>         <themekey>environment</themekey>         <themekey>inlandWaters</themekey>       </theme>       <place>         <placekt>None</placekt>         <placekey>Denver</placekey>         <placekey>Denver County</placekey>         <placekey>Colorado</placekey>         <placekey>USA</placekey>       </place>     </keywords>     <accconst>None</accconst>     <useconst>ACCESS CONSTRAINTS:   None. ANY DATA OR INFORMATION PROVIDED BY THE City and County of Denver IS PROVIDED "AS IS" WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, EITHER EXPRESSED OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.  Data or information provided by the City and County of Denver shall be used and relied upon only at the user's sole risk, and the user agrees to indemnify and hold harmless the City and County of Denver, its officials, officers and employees from any liability arising out of the use of the data/information provided. Environmental Quality</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>STREAMID</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Stream from which samples are collected.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>Denver Environmental Health - Environmental Quality</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>LOCATION_TYPE</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Sampling location description: instream, confluence, mixing zone, etc.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>Denver Environmental Health - Environmental Quality</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>TREND</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Long-term monitored to assess public health risks in areas with heavy recreational use.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>Denver Environmental Health - Environmental Quality</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr> Environmental Quality</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>FOCUS_STUDY</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Sampling location used for a special study or for evaluation of a particular focus area.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>Denver Environmental Health - Environmental Quality</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>OTHER</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Site sampled for other purpose and description of purrpose.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>Denver Environmental Health - Environmental Quality</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>HOTLINK</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Hotlink to photograph of sampling location.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>Denver Environmental Health - Environmental Quality</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>X_COORDINATE_1</attrlabl>         <attrdef>X coordinate in State Plane.  A value that represents the distance from an origin (0,0) along the horizontal axis (x). On a map, x,y coordinates are used to represent features at the location they are found on the earth's spherical surface.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>Denver Environmental Health - Environmental Quality</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>Y_COORDINATE_1</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Y coordinate in State Plane.  A values that represents the distance from an origin (0,0) along the vertical axis (y).  On a map, x,y coordinates are used to represent features at the location they are found on the earth's spherical surface.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>Denver Environmental Health - Environmental Quality</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>LATITUDE</attrlabl>         <attrdef>The angular distance, usually measured in degrees north or south of the equator. Lines of latitude are also referred to as parallels.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>ESRI</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>LONGITUDE</attrlabl>         <attrdef>The angular distance, usually expressed in degrees, minutes, and seconds, of the location of a point on the earth's surface east or west of an arbitrarily defined meridian (usually the Greenwich prime meridian). All lines of longitude are great circles that intersect the equator and pass through the North and South Poles.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>ESRI</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>DATUM_1</attrlabl>         <attrdef>State Plane Datum.  The reference specifications of a measurement system, usually a system of coordinate positions on a surface (a horizontal datum) or heights above or below a surface (a vertical datum).</attrdef>         <attrdefs>Denver Environmental Health - Environmental Quality</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>DATUM_2</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Geographic coordinate datum.  The reference specifications of a measurement system, usually a system of coordinate positions on a surface (a horizontal datum) or heights above or below a surface (a vertical datum).</attrdef>         <attrdefs>Denver Environmental Health - Environmental Quality</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>GLOBALID</attrlabl>         <attrdef>A field of type UUID (Universal Unique Identifier) in which values are automatically assigned by the geodatabase when a row is created. The GlobalID field is necessary for maintaining object uniqueness across replicas. All feature classes and tables participating in one-way or two-way replication must contain the GlobalID field. This field is not editable and is automatically populated when it is added for existing data.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>ESRI</attrdefs>       </attr>     </detailed>   </eainfo>   <distinfo>     <distrib>       <cntinfo>         <cntorgp>           <cntorg>City and County of Denver, Technology Services / Denver GIS Data </cntorg>         </cntorgp>         <cntaddr>           <addrtype>unknown</addrtype>           <address>201 W Colfax Ave, Dept 301</address>           <city>Denver</city>           <state>CO</state>           <postal>80202</postal>           <country>USA</country>         </cntaddr>         <cntfax>720-913-5237 </cntfax>         <cntemail>denvergis@denvergov.org</cntemail>         <hours>M-F 8:00am - 4:00pm (MT)</hours>       </cntinfo>     </distrib>     <distliab>See access and use constraints information.</distliab>   </distinfo>   <metainfo>     <metd>20130606</metd>     <metstdn>FGDC Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata</metstdn>     <metstdv>FGDC-STD-001-1998</metstdv>     <mettc>local time</mettc>   </metainfo> </metadata>
